programme.title: Get Smart
Portal smrti
programme.desc:
Get Smart: Directed by Peter Segal. With Steve Carell, Anne Hathaway, Dwayne Johnson, Alan Arkin. Maxwell Smart, a highly intellectual but bumbling spy working for the CONTROL agency, is tasked with preventing a terrorist attack from rival spy agency KAOS." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0425061/","name":"Get Smart","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY0NzQ4MDU0NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzA2NzQ2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Maxwell Smart, a highly intellectual but bumbling spy working for the CONTROL agency, is tasked with preventing a terrorist attack from rival spy agency KAOS.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0425061/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"NavyOrion"},"dateCreated":"2008-06-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just the right balance of comedy and action","reviewBody":"Yes, go see this movie. I know sometimes a preview looks pretty good and then the movie stinks (hello, Indiana Jones IV?) but this one does not disappoint.

I remember enjoying the "Get Smart" TV series when I was a kid, and like some other reviewers here, I feared the remake might screw it up (even though watching a couple of 5th-season episodes recently reminded me just how bad the show itself became late in the game.) But this movie version strikes just the right balance of action and comedy, while also balancing fresh ideas with welcome nods to the TV series.

After all, it wouldn't be "Get Smart" without "Would you believe...", "Sorry about that, Chief", or "Missed it by THAT much." It was also great to see such classics as the shoe phone, the Cone of Silence, Hymie the robot, and not one but two of the cars that Don Adams would have driven. But while some remakes mining the past for material have nothing new to say, and get stuck in paying homage to their predecessors, the "Get Smart" movie has a pretty good story of its own. 

Now this isn't Robert Ludlum material, and I doubt anyone is real surprised to see who turns out to be a bad guy, but it's a lot of fun along the way, with either a sight gag or surprisingly good action (and often both at the same time) coming down the pike every few minutes. There just aren't really any slow spots. I'm sure a lot of funny stuff got left on the cutting room floor (surely they didn't put Carrell in a fat suit for a mere ten seconds of film) but the pacing felt just right. We can catch all that other stuff when the DVD comes out at Christmas.

Steve Carrel plays Agent 86 almost exactly the way he portrays Dunder-Mifflin's Michael Scott. He comes off as basically well-meaning and earnest, and although a bit bumbling at times, his Maxwell Smart is thankfully not Don Adam's version. Neither was this one of those "Naked Gun" characters who stumbles into success despite his incompetence; Smart has some hilariously bad moments, but is never made out to be simply a lucky fool.

Carrell and Anne Hathaway have surprisingly good chemistry, and Alan Arkin is perfect taking over Edward Platt's role as "the Chief." Former wrestler Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson does a good job as Agent 23, and an even larger wrestler (7-foot 2-inch, 387-pound Dalip Singh from "The Longest Yard") is well-cast as a KAOS underling, although most of the other main bad guys are rather forgettable. Even TV-series KAOS agent Bernie Koppel shows up for a cameo, as does Patrick Warburton (who will be terrific in the inevitable sequel) and Bill Murray (almost unidentifiable hiding in a tree.) 

Bottom line: you won't come out of this movie feeling as if you were cheated out of your money. Judging from the laughter in the theater and smiles in the lobby as we left, a lot of folks agreed with me. This is going to make a ton of money, and deserves it. Look for "Get Smart II" in a couple of years, and let's just hope it is as good as this one. 

P.S. - It's rated PG-13, but there's very little that's objectionable for even younger viewers (Carrel rips the seat out of his pants.) Take the kids, and have a good time!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":210711,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2008-08-13","keywords":"spy,male nudity,evil man,good versus evil,ticklishness","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Get Smart: Trailer #3","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3202810137","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAzMDAwMjQ3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjkxMjQzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAzMDAwMjQ3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjkxMjQzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the third trailer for Get Smart, directed by Peter Segal."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0136797/","name":"Steve Carell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004266/","name":"Anne Hathaway"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000273/","name":"Alan Arkin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0781842/","name":"Peter Segal"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037759/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0040022/","name":"Tom J. Astle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256079/","name":"Matt Ember"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000316/","name":"Mel Brooks"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.review: --- Actors: Steve Carell (role=Maxwell Smart), Anne Hathaway (role=Agent 99), Dwayne Johnson (role=Agent 23), Alan Arkin (role=The Chief), Terence Stamp (role=Siegfried), Terry Crews (role=Agent 91), David Koechner (role=Larabee), James Caan (role=The President), Bill Murray (role=Agent 13), Patrick Warburton (role=Hymie), Masi Oka (role=Bruce), Nate Torrence (role=Lloyd)

IMDb data; ttnr: 0425061, Title: Get Smart, --- Description: Get Smart: Directed by Peter Segal. With Steve Carell, Anne Hathaway, Dwayne Johnson, Alan Arkin. Maxwell Smart, a highly intellectual but bumbling spy working for the CONTROL agency, is tasked with preventing a terrorist attack from rival spy agency KAOS." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0425061/","name":"Get Smart","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY0NzQ4MDU0NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzA2NzQ2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Maxwell Smart, a highly intellectual but bumbling spy working for the CONTROL agency, is tasked with preventing a terrorist attack from rival spy agency KAOS.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0425061/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"NavyOrion","dateCreated":"2008-06-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just the right balance of comedy and action","reviewBody":"Yes, go see this movie. I know sometimes a preview looks pretty good and then the movie stinks (hello, Indiana Jones IV?) but this one does not disappoint.

I remember enjoying the "Get Smart" TV series when I was a kid, and like some other reviewers here, I feared the remake might screw it up (even though watching a couple of 5th-season episodes recently reminded me just how bad the show itself became late in the game.) But this movie version strikes just the right balance of action and comedy, while also balancing fresh ideas with welcome nods to the TV series.

After all, it wouldn't be "Get Smart" without "Would you believe...", "Sorry about that, Chief", or "Missed it by THAT much." It was also great to see such classics as the shoe phone, the Cone of Silence, Hymie the robot, and not one but two of the cars that Don Adams would have driven. But while some remakes mining the past for material have nothing new to say, and get stuck in paying homage to their predecessors, the "Get Smart" movie has a pretty good story of its own. 

Now this isn't Robert Ludlum material, and I doubt anyone is real surprised to see who turns out to be a bad guy, but it's a lot of fun along the way, with either a sight gag or surprisingly good action (and often both at the same time) coming down the pike every few minutes. There just aren't really any slow spots. I'm sure a lot of funny stuff got left on the cutting room floor (surely they didn't put Carrell in a fat suit for a mere ten seconds of film) but the pacing felt just right. We can catch all that other stuff when the DVD comes out at Christmas.

Steve Carrel plays Agent 86 almost exactly the way he portrays Dunder-Mifflin's Michael Scott. He comes off as basically well-meaning and earnest, and although a bit bumbling at times, his Maxwell Smart is thankfully not Don Adam's version. Neither was this one of those "Naked Gun" characters who stumbles into success despite his incompetence; Smart has some hilariously bad moments, but is never made out to be simply a lucky fool.

Carrell and Anne Hathaway have surprisingly good chemistry, and Alan Arkin is perfect taking over Edward Platt's role as "the Chief." Former wrestler Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson does a good job as Agent 23, and an even larger wrestler (7-foot 2-inch, 387-pound Dalip Singh from "The Longest Yard") is well-cast as a KAOS underling, although most of the other main bad guys are rather forgettable. Even TV-series KAOS agent Bernie Koppel shows up for a cameo, as does Patrick Warburton (who will be terrific in the inevitable sequel) and Bill Murray (almost unidentifiable hiding in a tree.) 

Bottom line: you won't come out of this movie feeling as if you were cheated out of your money. Judging from the laughter in the theater and smiles in the lobby as we left, a lot of folks agreed with me. This is going to make a ton of money, and deserves it. Look for "Get Smart II" in a couple of years, and let's just hope it is as good as this one. 

P.S. - It's rated PG-13, but there's very little that's objectionable for even younger viewers (Carrel rips the seat out of his pants.) Take the kids, and have a good time!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":210711,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2008-08-13","keywords":"spy,male nudity,evil man,good versus evil,ticklishness","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Get Smart: Trailer #3","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3202810137","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAzMDAwMjQ3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjkxMjQzMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAzMDAwMjQ3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjkxMjQzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the third trailer for Get Smart, directed by Peter Segal.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0136797/","name":"Steve Carell","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004266/","name":"Anne Hathaway","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000273/","name":"Alan Arkin"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0781842/","name":"Peter Segal"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037759/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0040022/","name":"Tom J. programme.title: Enigma
Enigma
programme.desc:
Enigma: Directed by Michael Apted. With Dougray Scott, Kate Winslet, Saffron Burrows, Jeremy Northam. A young genius frantically races against time to crack an enemy code and solve the mystery surrounding the woman he loves." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0157583/","name":"Enigma","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTI5ODU3N2UtM2QzNS00NjM1LWExNzMtNjgzYWQ5MWNkYTJmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjA0MzYwMDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young genius frantically races against time to crack an enemy code and solve the mystery surrounding the woman he loves.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0157583/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ma-cortes"},"dateCreated":"2004-07-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good suspense war film","reviewBody":"The movie concerns upon an investigation team in the Bletchley Park mansion with the aim to decipher communication keys of German submarines during second world war.

In the squad there are a wise nut-head (Dougray Scott) , an ugly and outcast girl (Kate Winslet) and another rush and beautiful (Saffron Burrows), and yet a clever investigator (Jeremy Norton).

The movie mingles mystery , action , a love story , thriller and it's quite amusing.

The flick is paced to nick of time , as they ought to figure out the clues by means of the Enigma , a mechanical device before that an Allied fleet was found by German subs .

One of the motivations behind shooting this picture was the indignation of many British World War 2 veterans over the movie U-571 , in which the capture of the Enigma was shown to be done by American navy soldiers . 

Michael Apted direction is nice , he creates enough suspense , we're very interested in the events , besides being based on real deeds.

Final feature film with a full music score composed by John Barry , his music is fascinating likeness to "Dancing with wolves" and a lot of hits during his long career thirty years ago .

It was such a thrilling movie that had a great success in box office.

The film will appeal to emotions enthusiasts and suspense fans.

Rating: 7/10 above average .","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20685,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Romance"],"datePublished":"2001-09-28","keywords":"code breaking,traitor,world war two,bletchley park,spy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Enigma","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1084555545","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmRjYTdmYTYtNWY4ZC00N2FiLWEzZDUtNzk3MTc4ZDE5MGI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmRjYTdmYTYtNWY4ZC00N2FiLWEzZDUtNzk3MTc4ZDE5MGI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0779084/","name":"Dougray Scott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000701/","name":"Kate Winslet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004787/","name":"Saffron Burrows"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000776/","name":"Michael Apted"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076402/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010183/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057092/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0365249/","name":"Robert Harris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001779/","name":"Tom Stoppard"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Girl with a Pearl Earring: Directed by Peter Webber. With Colin Firth, Scarlett Johansson, Tom Wilkinson, Judy Parfitt. A young peasant maid working in the house of painter Johannes Vermeer becomes his talented assistant and the model for one of his most famous works." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0335119/","name":"Girl with a Pearl Earring","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3NTg5NDYtNWNkMC00ODZiLTljZjQtNjZhNjlhNjZiNDBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young peasant maid working in the house of painter Johannes Vermeer becomes his talented assistant and the model for one of his most famous works.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0335119/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"xristost"},"dateCreated":"2005-01-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautiful like the painting of an old Dutch master","reviewBody":"I have just seen "Girl with a pearl earring" and I am already willing to see it again. The feeling is very much the same as wanting another tour in a gallery of paintings of old Dutch masters, to enjoy repeatedly the beauty of light and shadow and colours. Scarlett Johansson is both very pretty and talented and the camera lovingly moves around her, searching for her beautiful eyes and puffy lustful lips, very much reminding me of Bertolucci's love for the beauty of Liv Tyler in "Stealing beauty". Colin Firth is again producing a most powerful impact by his tall dominating figure, deep beautiful voice and reserved yet sensual and passionate attitude. A strikingly good picture in the ocean of mediocre productions.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":76074,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2004-01-16","keywords":"artist's model,painter,johannes vermeer,art studio,master servant relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Girl with a Pearl Earring","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3265593625","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTdkOWVkZjItNDViYS00NTYwLTkxMGYtYWRkNTYwM2NmY2M2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTdkOWVkZjItNDViYS00NTYwLTkxMGYtYWRkNTYwM2NmY2M2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0424060/","name":"Scarlett Johansson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000147/","name":"Colin Firth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929489/","name":"Tom Wilkinson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0916424/","name":"Peter Webber"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104308/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022758/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022869/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1256768/","name":"Tracy Chevalier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381757/","name":"Olivia Hetreed"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bijeg s planeta Zemlje
programme.desc: Kada lakovjerni astronaut Scorch Supernova odgovori na SOS poziv nepoznatog pošiljatelja i krene u pomoć, upast će u zamku totalno šašavih svemiraca... Svemirska avantura novih crtanih junaka Cala Brunkera autora hitova Ledeno doba i Gru na supertajnom zadatku! Zemljine najveće tajne bit će razotkrivene! Kada lakovjerni astronaut Scorch Supernova odgovori na SOS poziv nepoznatog pošiljatelja i krene u pomoć, upast će u zamku totalno šašavih svemiraca…nađe se u stupici zlih sila na udaljenom "Mračnom planetu" poznatom pod imenom Zemlja otkud ga može spasiti samo njegov brat Gary - u animiranom obiteljskom komično-avanturističkom filmu Bijeg s planeta Zemlje.

programme.title: Hachi: A Dog's Tale
Hachiko: Priča o psu
programme.desc:
Hachi: A Dog's Tale: Directed by Lasse Hallström. With Richard Gere, Joan Allen, Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, Sarah Roemer. Hachiko is a true story about a dog in Japan and the special bond he shared with a professor whom he met when it was a little puppy. The story has been put forward exceptionally well by the cast and the director.

The movie has been kept extremely simple with minimum effort on the scenes, yet remarkably you are kept spellbound after a couple of minutes into the movie. And as the other reviews suggest, making the whole theater grab onto their tissues explains how good it really is.

programme.desc:
Non-Stop: Directed by Jaume Collet-Serra. With Liam Neeson, Julianne Moore, Scoot McNairy, Michelle Dockery. An air marshal springs into action during a transatlantic flight after receiving a series of text messages demanding $150 million into an off-shore account, or someone will die every 20 minutes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2024469/","name":"Non-Stop","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTI3NzcxMjkzMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDY0NTQ0MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An air marshal springs into action during a transatlantic flight after receiving a series of text messages demanding $150 million into an off-shore account, or someone will die every 20 minutes.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2024469/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"statuskuo"},"dateCreated":"2014-03-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Keeps You Guessing","reviewBody":"This surprised me. A thriller on a plane that has you thinking you know all the answers (because we're such expert movie watches), then flips it. Yes, it's a contrived subplot. And the reasoning behind this terrorist act is goofy, BUT...it is a lot of fun. It interweaves a really elaborate set-up that you have to focus on to understand.

Also, for people who think they're sophisticated in camera motion. Think about that space. The camera moves in (perceived) 360 degrees without a) seeing camera shadow b) camera angle is near impossible with the movements they had. This is visually sophistication that most won't see or care. But it adds a ton to the claustrophobia.

Julianne Moore is great, as always. Neeson is perfect for this role, but one has to wonder how this behemoth of a guy fits in a airplane bathroom.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":257478,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2014-02-26","keywords":"die hard scenario,passenger,mind game,deception,suspense","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1005889561","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk5NzE5OTMxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODUxMjU0MDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk5NzE5OTMxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODUxMjU0MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"During a transatlantic flight from New York City to London, U.S. Air Marshal Bill Marks receives a series of cryptic text messages demanding that he instruct the airline to transfer $150 million into an off-shore account. programme.title: Dirty Grandpa
Djedica pušten s lanca
programme.desc:
Dirty Grandpa: Directed by Dan Mazer. With Robert De Niro, Zac Efron, Zoey Deutch, Aubrey Plaza. Right before his wedding, an uptight guy is tricked into driving his grandfather, a lecherous former Army Lieutenant Colonel, to Florida for Spring Break." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1860213/","name":"Dirty Grandpa","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk0NzkyNDk2M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDczOTU3NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Right before his wedding, an uptight guy is tricked into driving his grandfather, a lecherous former Army Lieutenant Colonel, to Florida for Spring Break.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1860213/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lnvicta"},"dateCreated":"2016-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Know what you're getting into and you can have fun with Dirty Grandpa.","reviewBody":"Once the credits started rolling for Dirty Grandpa, the only thing I could say was, "Oh my god." It was shocking. From beginning to end the movie is shock humor, gross-out humor, crass, offensive, childish and stupid. But you know what? I laughed a lot. I'd be lying if I said I wasn't entertained throughout most of this movie. Sure, it follows a lot of road trip movie tropes and the perfunctory fight/make-up conflict near the end, but one thing about Dirty Grandpa is that it's consistent. Dirty joke after dirty joke; some of them hit, some of them miss, but they don't stop. Some of these things I never thought I'd hear come out of Robert De Niro's mouth, but the fact that it's him saying it makes it all the more funny. People will say this is a slap in the face to his legacy, but it really isn't. The Family was. Little Fockers was. This movie knows what it is - a lewd, politically incorrect road trip comedy, and it succeeds in that regard.

What surprised me most about Dirty Grandpa is the chemistry between Zac Efron and Robert De Niro. They have a great comedic rapport that actually feels authentic, which helps the more insane scenes retain some semblance of realism (as thin as it may be). The rest of the cast is enjoyable too, especially Aubrey Plaza as the overtly slutty college girl who continuously surprised me with every grotesque statement uttered from her mouth. Oddly enough, De Niro feels right at home here. It's as if his character from Meet the Parents went off the deep end and decided to go on a spring break road trip with Zac Efron. Seriously, his character is ex-special forces and everything. Efron also proves once again that he's a comedic force to be reckoned with playing the straight corporate man put in awkward social situations.

I don't know what people were expecting from Dirty Grandpa. Look at the title, look at the trailers. Are you really surprised? It was marketed as a gross-out comedy from day one, and guess what? It's gross. It's vile; it's degrading; it's shockingly inappropriate. Is it a good movie? Not a chance in hell. But the goal of a comedy is to make the viewer laugh, and Dirty Grandpa made me laugh. Hard.

Now, if you don't like offensive humor, you should stay the hell away from this. Just know what you're getting into before seeing Dirty Grandpa and you can definitely have some fun watching it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":118750,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2016-01-22","keywords":"grandfather grandson relationship,cowgirl sex position,nymphomaniac,sleeping naked,nudity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1755362585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjk0MDkyNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTA5MzQ2NzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjk0MDkyNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTA5MzQ2NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Right before his wedding, an uptight guy is tricked into driving his grandfather, a former Army general, to Florida for spring break."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1374980/","name":"Zac Efron"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3614913/","name":"Zoey Deutch"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0563243/","name":"Dan Mazer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0577142/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0178111/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4544229/","name":"John Phillips"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Kinsey: Directed by Bill Condon. With Liam Neeson, Laura Linney, Chris O'Donnell, Peter Sarsgaard. A look at the life of Alfred Kinsey, a pioneer in the area of human sexuality research, whose 1948 publication "Sexual Behavior in the Human Male" was one of the first recorded works that saw science address sexual behavior." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0362269/","name":"Kinsey","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA0MjA1MjA4MDNeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDQxMDQ2MjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A look at the life of Alfred Kinsey, a pioneer in the area of human sexuality research, whose 1948 publication "Sexual Behavior in the Human Male" was one of the first recorded works that saw science address sexual behavior.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0362269/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jotix100"},"dateCreated":"2004-11-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Before Dr. Ruth and the others, there was Dr. Kinsey...","reviewBody":"Bill Condon, working with his own material has come out with a movie that serves to illustrate how the work of Dr. Kinsey awoke the American public to a better understanding of their sexuality in ways no one, up to that point, had ever dared to show. As he proved with his other film, "Gods and Monsters", Mr. Condon shows he doesn't mind tackling adult themes, so scarce in the present cinema.

The film is documentary in style, as we are shown the life of Kinsey at different times of his life. He had an unhappy childhood. His father was a tyrant who never really showed love toward him. There are moments when the young Kinsey is shown as boy scout and there is an element of homosexuality that maybe, for fear, never came to the surface, but it's there, nonetheless.

Dr. Kinsey's life takes a turn when he meets, Clara McMillen, who he calls "Mac". It's with her that he begins a life of discovery in the field of human sexuality that was taboo in American colleges and universities at the time. Albert Kinsey was the first one that spoke about the things that were never said in polite company, or in the classroom, up to that moment. His life was dedicated to understand what made human beings act the way they did, never being judgmental, but with a tremendous insight to interpret the data and present it in a comprehensible way.

A puritanical American society reacted strongly against the findings of Dr. Kinsey. He was a man ahead of his times when he decided to gather information about the sex lives of Americans and to publish the results in a best selling book.

As Dr. Kinsey, Liam Neeson, showing an uncanny resemblance to the man, himself, does a wonderful job. He shows a complicated character who was not easily understood by his associates and students. As "Mac", his wife, Laura Linney with a dark wig, gives an articulate performance of Mrs. Kinsey. Both actors are wonderful together, as they have already shown in the New York stage. 

Peter Sargaard, as Clyde, Dr. Kinsey's first assistant, shows he is an actor that will amaze from picture to picture. This actor has the ability to get under each of his character's skins to make them real, as is the case with his Clyde. Also, almost unrecognizable, Chris O'Donnell, who plays Wardell, one of the interviewers working with the doctor. Timothy Hutton is Gebhard, the other associate who was instrumental in gathering the information to help complete Dr. Kinsey's report. John Lithgow, as Kinsey Sr. has a fantastic moment with Mr. Neeson, as he agrees to be interviewed, revealing a horrible secret. It's a wonderful moment done with panache by both actors working under exceptional direction.

There is a moment toward the end of the film where we see Lynn Redgrave speaking directly to the camera. It is one of the most effective moments in the film when this woman tells Dr. Kinsey about her life as a lesbian.

Mr. Condon's film clarifies a lot about the genius of Kinsey and his contribution to society.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":48493,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2005-01-07","keywords":"sexuality,character name as title,surname as title,lgbt plus,sex","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Kinsey","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2224292121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjMyNjcwODktYjI3MC00ODVmLTlkOTktMmI5NDYyNzVhYjljXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjMyNjcwODktYjI3MC00ODVmLTlkOTktMmI5NDYyNzVhYjljXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000553/","name":"Liam Neeson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001473/","name":"Laura Linney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000563/","name":"Chris O'Donnell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174374/","name":"Bill Condon"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028932/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0102795/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0107069/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174374/","name":"Bill Condon"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
Djevojka s bisernom naušnicom
programme.desc: Girl with a Pearl Earring: Directed by Peter Webber. With Colin Firth, Scarlett Johansson, Tom Wilkinson, Judy Parfitt. A young peasant maid working in the house of painter Johannes Vermeer becomes his talented assistant and the model for one of his most famous works." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0335119/","name":"Girl with a Pearl Earring","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3NTg5NDYtNWNkMC00ODZiLTljZjQtNjZhNjlhNjZiNDBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young peasant maid working in the house of painter Johannes Vermeer becomes his talented assistant and the model for one of his most famous works.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0335119/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"xristost"},"dateCreated":"2005-01-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautiful like the painting of an old Dutch master","reviewBody":"I have just seen "Girl with a pearl earring" and I am already willing to see it again. The feeling is very much the same as wanting another tour in a gallery of paintings of old Dutch masters, to enjoy repeatedly the beauty of light and shadow and colours. Scarlett Johansson is both very pretty and talented and the camera lovingly moves around her, searching for her beautiful eyes and puffy lustful lips, very much reminding me of Bertolucci's love for the beauty of Liv Tyler in "Stealing beauty". Colin Firth is again producing a most powerful impact by his tall dominating figure, deep beautiful voice and reserved yet sensual and passionate attitude. A strikingly good picture in the ocean of mediocre productions.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":76074,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2004-01-16","keywords":"artist's model,painter,johannes vermeer,art studio,master servant relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Girl with a Pearl Earring","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3265593625","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTdkOWVkZjItNDViYS00NTYwLTkxMGYtYWRkNTYwM2NmY2M2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTdkOWVkZjItNDViYS00NTYwLTkxMGYtYWRkNTYwM2NmY2M2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0424060/","name":"Scarlett Johansson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000147/","name":"Colin Firth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929489/","name":"Tom Wilkinson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0916424/","name":"Peter Webber"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104308/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022758/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022869/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1256768/","name":"Tracy Chevalier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381757/","name":"Olivia Hetreed"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Diamantino
Diamantino
programme.desc:
Diamantino: Directed by Gabriel Abrantes, Daniel Schmidt. With Carloto Cotta, Cleo Tavares, Anabela Moreira, Margarida Moreira. A fallen soccer superstar vows to adopt a refugee child, while becoming the naive unwitting centerpiece in in a bizarre plot to Make Portugal Great Again." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6522668/","name":"Diamantino","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTEwN2ZmYzUtNTc3NC00MTZiLWIyZTEtMGNhMjVhYjJkNjRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI3NDAyNg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A fallen soccer superstar vows to adopt a refugee child, while becoming the naive unwitting centerpiece in in a bizarre plot to Make Portugal Great Again.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6522668/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nairtejas"},"dateCreated":"2019-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"EUFF Review: Diamantino (7 Stars)","reviewBody":"Diamantino (given Portuguese name) is the best film I watched at EUFF 2019, a story that is relevant and funny it took me by surprise and made me regret I skipped it in 2018 at the MAMI MFF.

Narrating the story of a footballer who fell from glory to disgrace because of one missed goal, Diamantino takes you through government propaganda, fascism, illegal scientific studies, and a sweet little relationship between the eponymous character (the brilliant and talented Carloto Cotta whose face itself is so perfect for the role he plays) and a boy that he adopts when he learns about the refugee crisis. The humor is laugh-out-loud here, both through the dialogues and the visuals that is just magically delivered in a snappy screenplay of 90 minutes. The performances are the next highlight of the film, especially the sisters who played Diamantino's sisters on screen. Such beauty and sinister-ship they carry, you cannot take eyes off them when they are on the screen. But come to think of it, this is a film where you can't do it anyway because it's fun... absurdist, but just pure fun. The wit and wordplay is also very strong here. It will most importantly remind you of a real-life footballer who hails from the same country this film is set in... TN.

(Watched and reviewed at the 24th European Union Film Festival (EUFF India) in Mumbai.)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2743,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"genre":["Comedy","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2018-11-28","keywords":"lesbian,male frontal nudity,skinny dipping,female frontal nudity,soccer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Diamantino","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4175674393","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGVkZmVjMWEtOTM0OS00YjBjLTg4NGEtNWMxMjk1N2E2YjkxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGVkZmVjMWEtOTM0OS00YjBjLTg4NGEtNWMxMjk1N2E2YjkxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1929018/","name":"Carloto Cotta"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8148648/","name":"Cleo Tavares"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1335025/","name":"Anabela Moreira"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4085019/","name":"Gabriel Abrantes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4116978/","name":"Daniel Schmidt"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0653263/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0146367/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0351710/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4085019/","name":"Gabriel Abrantes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4116978/","name":"Daniel Schmidt"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.review: --- Actors: Carloto Cotta (role=Diamantino Matamouros), Cleo Tavares (role=Aisha Brito), Anabela Moreira (role=Sonia Matamouros), Margarida Moreira (role=Natasha Matamouros), Carla Maciel (role=Dr. Lamborghini), Chico Chapas (role=Chico Matamouros), Hugo Santos Silva (role=Mouro), Joana Barrios (role=Minister Ferro), Filipe Vargas (role=Helena Guerra), Maria Leite (role=Lucia), Manuela Moura Guedes (role=Gisele), Djucu Dabo (role=Refugee Woman)

A fallen soccer superstar vows to adopt a refugee child, while becoming the naive unwitting centerpiece in in a bizarre plot to Make Portugal Great Again." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6522668/","name":"Diamantino","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTEwN2ZmYzUtNTc3NC00MTZiLWIyZTEtMGNhMjVhYjJkNjRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI3NDAyNg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A fallen soccer superstar vows to adopt a refugee child, while becoming the naive unwitting centerpiece in in a bizarre plot to Make Portugal Great Again.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6522668/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"nairtejas","dateCreated":"2019-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"EUFF Review: Diamantino (7 Stars)","reviewBody":"Diamantino (given Portuguese name) is the best film I watched at EUFF 2019, a story that is relevant and funny it took me by surprise and made me regret I skipped it in 2018 at the MAMI MFF.

Narrating the story of a footballer who fell from glory to disgrace because of one missed goal, Diamantino takes you through government propaganda, fascism, illegal scientific studies, and a sweet little relationship between the eponymous character (the brilliant and talented Carloto Cotta whose face itself is so perfect for the role he plays) and a boy that he adopts when he learns about the refugee crisis. The humor is laugh-out-loud here, both through the dialogues and the visuals that is just magically delivered in a snappy screenplay of 90 minutes. The performances are the next highlight of the film, especially the sisters who played Diamantino's sisters on screen. Such beauty and sinister-ship they carry, you cannot take eyes off them when they are on the screen. But come to think of it, this is a film where you can't do it anyway because it's fun... absurdist, but just pure fun. The wit and wordplay is also very strong here. It will most importantly remind you of a real-life footballer who hails from the same country this film is set in... TN.

(Watched and reviewed at the 24th European Union Film Festival (EUFF India) in Mumbai.)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2743,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"genre":["Comedy","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2018-11-28","keywords":"lesbian,male frontal nudity,skinny dipping,female frontal nudity,soccer","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Diamantino","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4175674393","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGVkZmVjMWEtOTM0OS00YjBjLTg4NGEtNWMxMjk1N2E2YjkxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGVkZmVjMWEtOTM0OS00YjBjLTg4NGEtNWMxMjk1N2E2YjkxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1929018/","name":"Carloto Cotta","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8148648/","name":"Cleo Tavares","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1335025/","name":"Anabela Moreira"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4085019/","name":"Gabriel Abrantes","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4116978/","name":"Daniel Schmidt"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0653263/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0146367/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0351710/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4085019/","name":"Gabriel Abrantes","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4116978/","name":"Daniel Schmidt"],"duration":"PT1H36M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hachi: A Dog's Tale
Hachiko: Priča o psu
programme.desc:
Hachi: A Dog's Tale: Directed by Lasse Hallström. With Richard Gere, Joan Allen, Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, Sarah Roemer. A college professor bonds with an abandoned dog he takes into his home." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1028532/","name":"Hachi: A Dog's Tale","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzE4NDg5OWMtMzg3NC00ZDRjLTllMDMtZTRjNWZmNjBmMGZlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A college professor bonds with an abandoned dog he takes into his home.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1028532/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ankurin"},"dateCreated":"2010-02-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"You cannot get it any better than this","reviewBody":"Its really hard to articulate when you have so much to write and so little words to express. And even lesser words which could actually help you convey what you want to say. The closest word which comes to my mind in this case is 'stupendous'.

Hachiko is a true story about a dog in Japan and the special bond he shared with a professor whom he met when it was a little puppy. The story has been put forward exceptionally well by the cast and the director.

The movie has been kept extremely simple with minimum effort on the scenes, yet remarkably you are kept spellbound after a couple of minutes into the movie. And as the other reviews suggest, making the whole theater grab onto their tissues explains how good it really is.

Lastly, coming for someone who also rates 'Eight below' as one of his favorite's, a high rating of Hachiko would seem a little biased to many. But in my honest opinion I don't think that anybody who has watched this movie can rate it below 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":267843,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Biography","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"2010-03-12","keywords":"dog,japanese,loyalty,waiting,human animal relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hachi: A Dog's Tale","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2296906777","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWM0YmRjMjMtNzRhMS00ZDhjLWJmZDMtMWM0OWU4YTI3Yzc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWM0YmRjMjMtNzRhMS00ZDhjLWJmZDMtMWM0OWU4YTI3Yzc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this heart warming story about man's best friend"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000152/","name":"Richard Gere"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000260/","name":"Joan Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0846480/","name":"Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002120/","name":"Lasse Hallström"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0222021/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0119195/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0341749/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2124742/","name":"Stephen P. programme.title: Non-Stop
Non stop
programme.desc:
Non-Stop: Directed by Jaume Collet-Serra. With Liam Neeson, Julianne Moore, Scoot McNairy, Michelle Dockery. An air marshal springs into action during a transatlantic flight after receiving a series of text messages demanding $150 million into an off-shore account, or someone will die every 20 minutes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2024469/","name":"Non-Stop","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTI3NzcxMjkzMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDY0NTQ0MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An air marshal springs into action during a transatlantic flight after receiving a series of text messages demanding $150 million into an off-shore account, or someone will die every 20 minutes.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2024469/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"statuskuo"},"dateCreated":"2014-03-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Keeps You Guessing","reviewBody":"This surprised me. A thriller on a plane that has you thinking you know all the answers (because we're such expert movie watches), then flips it. Yes, it's a contrived subplot. And the reasoning behind this terrorist act is goofy, BUT...it is a lot of fun. It interweaves a really elaborate set-up that you have to focus on to understand.

Also, for people who think they're sophisticated in camera motion. Think about that space. The camera moves in (perceived) 360 degrees without a) seeing camera shadow b) camera angle is near impossible with the movements they had. This is visually sophistication that most won't see or care. But it adds a ton to the claustrophobia.

Julianne Moore is great, as always. Neeson is perfect for this role, but one has to wonder how this behemoth of a guy fits in a airplane bathroom.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":257478,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2014-02-26","keywords":"die hard scenario,passenger,mind game,deception,suspense","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1005889561","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk5NzE5OTMxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODUxMjU0MDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk5NzE5OTMxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODUxMjU0MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"During a transatlantic flight from New York City to London, U.S. Air Marshal Bill Marks receives a series of cryptic text messages demanding that he instruct the airline to transfer $150 million into an off-shore account. Until he secures the money, a passenger on his flight will be killed every 20 minutes. programme.title: The Light Between Oceans
Svjetlo između oceana
programme.desc: The Light Between Oceans: Directed by Derek Cianfrance. With Michael Fassbender, Alicia Vikander, Rachel Weisz, Florence Clery. A lighthouse keeper and his wife living off the coast of Western Australia raise a baby they rescue from a drifting rowing boat." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2547584/","name":"The Light Between Oceans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTI1NzQzMjgxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTY1OTY2OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A lighthouse keeper and his wife living off the coast of Western Australia raise a baby they rescue from a drifting rowing boat.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2547584/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Ramascreen"},"dateCreated":"2016-08-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Tugs at your heartstrings","reviewBody":"You better take a box of Kleenex with you to the screening of #TheLightBetweenOceans because you're going to need it, trust me. Heartbreaking pretty much encapsulates the entirety of this film which from the start aims to drive its point home on an emotional level. Based on M.L. Stedman's best-selling novel, starring Michael Fassbender, Alicia Vikander, Rachel Weisz, Bryan Brown, and Jack Thompson, adapted and directed by Derek Cianfrance, THE LIGHT BETWEEN OCEANS is essentially about a lighthouse keeper and his wife living off the coast of Western Australia and they raise a baby they rescue from an adrift rowboat. But years later, the lighthouse keeper and his wife encounter the real mother of that baby. Should they go on with their lie and keep their child or do they tell the truth and risk losing her forever? I've never been a parent, so I don't know what it feels like, because I can only imagine that the fear or anxiety of the possibility of losing your child through any circumstance crosses the minds of every parent who wouldn't want such misfortune befalls them. In this case, it cuts even deeper because it's about miscarriage, to have that happen to a woman whose dream is to become a mother, it's the worst nightmare for her. In THE LIGHT BETWEEN OCEANS, I think Alicia Vikander plays that with such strong conviction and ferocity, so much so that even though you know her character is doing something wrong, a part of you wants her to get away with this act, because Vikander has made you feel sorrowful for what her character has gone through. It's a remarkable performance for a woman who won Oscar for last year's "The Danish Girl," you see THE LIGHT BETWEEN OCEANS and you'll immediately understand exactly why she deserves that statuette. And Michael Fassbender plays the lighthouse keeper husband with a conscience, the film does deal with fate, love, moral dilemmas, and how far you're willing to go to get your dreams realized after having previously seen them crushed a few times, what secrets would you keep to make those dreams realized and so Fassbender's moral compass keeps bugging him. Fassbender is so gentle and sturdy and calmed in this film. If you've seen director Derek Cianfrance's previous films, "Blue Valentine" and "The Place Beyond The Pines," you'd know that Cianfrance is not one to shy away from couples' confrontations, it's as if he wants his actors to really unleash their strongest resentment possible, so when conflict arises between Vikander's character and Fassbender's character or between Vikander and Rachel Weisz's character, it's so real and ugly that you wouldn't want to get in the middle of it otherwise they might come at you as well. The cinematography for this film is exquisite, such a beautifully designed, beautifully shot film, not to mention composer Alexandre Desplat's music, his emphasis on piano, that makes the emotional journey of these characters all the more deeply affecting. THE LIGHT BETWEEN OCEANS guarantees to tug at the heartstrings. -- Rama's Screen --","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":54781,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2016-09-02","keywords":"lighthouse,husband wife relationship,lighthouse keeper,loss of husband,1920s","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2715005977","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0NzQwMTY5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTExMDA5ODE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0NzQwMTY5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTExMDA5ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A drama centered around a lighthouse keeper and his wife who live off the coast of Western Australia. Happening upon a baby they rescue from an adrift rowboat, the couple make the life-altering decision to raise the child as their own."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1055413/","name":"Michael Fassbender"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2539953/","name":"Alicia Vikander"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001838/","name":"Rachel Weisz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161834/","name":"Derek Cianfrance"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0159772/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0553897/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161834/","name":"Derek Cianfrance"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5390305/","name":"M.L. Stedman"}],"duration":"PT2H13M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Donnie Darko
Donnie Darko
programme.desc:
Donnie Darko: Directed by Richard Kelly. With Jake Gyllenhaal, Holmes Osborne, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Daveigh Chase. After narrowly escaping a bizarre accident, a troubled teenager is plagued by visions of a man in a large rabbit suit who manipulates him to commit a series of crimes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0246578/","name":"Donnie Darko","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjZlZDlkYTktMmU1My00ZDBiLWFlNjEtYTBhNjVhOTM4ZjJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"After narrowly escaping a bizarre accident, a troubled teenager is plagued by visions of a man in a large rabbit suit who manipulates him to commit a series of crimes.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0246578/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lwjoslin"},"dateCreated":"2002-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"the dreams in which I'm dying are the best I've ever had","reviewBody":""Harvey" meets "The Mothman Prophecies," as a troubled teen starts hallucinating a horrific 6-foot-tall bunny rabbit that brings him dark forebodings about death and disaster in the very near future. A streak of "Heathers" is mixed in as well, with trenchant satirical observations of high-school life in the late '80s (story set in Oct. 1988), involving a priggish teacher, a self-help guru (Patrick Swayze!), and a put-upon fat girl at the fringes of the herd. Finally, a whiff of "Back to the Future," in the form of a local eccentric who just may have discovered the secret of time travel, but a secret that has more to do with spirituality than technology.

 A lot goes on here. There's a meditation on the possible overlap between madness and the ability to perceive the divine. There's a demonstration of why, in the Bible, angelic messengers (if that's what "Frank" can be taken to be) are often so terrifying that they have to start by saying "Fear not." There's an enlistment of what martial artists refer to as the "ki" (or personal energy, emanating from a person's midsection) in the type of time travel depicted here (the term "ki" is never used in the flick, but the term "path," another word for Tao or "Way," is). Quantum physics theory about wormholes is tied to the Fortean phenomenon of things falling unexplained from the sky, in a way that's more pivotal, and therefore more interesting, than the gratuitous rain of frogs in "Magnolia." 

 Time travel paradoxes and ironies enter the picture as well. One character (no spoiler!), whose life is saved by Donnie's ultimate trip back in time, wouldn't have died in the first place if he hadn't dragged her along to the opening of the wormhole. Another character (again, no spoiler!), whose truly terrible secret comes to light in the wake of an arson investigation, must go unexposed as a result of that same time reversal, since the arson now won't happen. Surely that's no oversight on the part of the screenwriter; it must be an acknowledgment of the choices and trade-offs in life, as well as of a confidence that no such terrible secret can remain hidden forever. 

 Somehow this pastiche works, largely on the strength of good performances. Jake Gyllenhaal is appropriately moody and, also appropriately, not always likeable in the title role. Drew Barrymore, who executive produced, appears as a frustrated first-year teacher. The movie's often dreamlike atmosphere is enhanced by the cinematography, the subdued but effective special effects, and the choice of the music on the soundtrack, which includes '80's pop tunes, of course, and a haunting original song (over the end credits) titled "Mad World."

 Not for all tastes, but better, stranger, and more complex than I expected."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":765525,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2001-01-19","keywords":"surrealism,mental illness,cult film,cult classic,schizophrenic","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Donnie Darko: 15th Anniversary","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1835513369","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODhiOWQ2NTItOTMxMy00NTNlLWFhOWYtMjFiNzdjYjg4NjY2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODhiOWQ2NTItOTMxMy00NTNlLWFhOWYtMjFiNzdjYjg4NjY2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Donnie Darko: 15th Anniversary"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0350453/","name":"Jake Gyllenhaal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0540441/","name":"Jena Malone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001521/","name":"Mary McDonnell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0446819/","name":"Richard Kelly"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008059/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0148520/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064962/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0446819/","name":"Richard Kelly"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dark Waters
Mutne vode
programme.desc: Dark Waters: Directed by Todd Haynes. With Mark Ruffalo, Anne Hathaway, Tim Robbins, Bill Pullman. A corporate defense attorney takes on an environmental lawsuit against a chemical company that exposes a lengthy history of pollution." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9071322/","name":"Dark Waters","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQ0M2Y5M2QtZGIwMC00MzJjLThlMzYtNmE3ZTMzZTYzOGEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A corporate defense attorney takes on an environmental lawsuit against a chemical company that exposes a lengthy history of pollution.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9071322/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"statuskuo"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Corporation Does Not Factor Humanity","reviewBody":"There's nothing here that you have not seen. Go ahead and call it "Aaron Brockovich." But director Todd Haynes still makes it entirely engaging and painfully true that death is a number compared to liability and that is how you can sustain cold hearted industry. Made more gut wrenching is how they believed the ends justified the means. Mark Ruffalo tackles the lawyer with the conscience wonderfully. Suffering under the weight of what he must do and what then envelops his small world. It's heroic in how much he does sacrifice and let's face it, these stories don't end well. What director Haynes does is put a face to the not-on-the-books crime. And though, it only is a civil case somehow you sense the frustration of the town. Not played as rubes but believing that a massive corporation who funded and gave perks to sustain the village wouldn't willingly destroy it. As we know now versus 1998, they knew...if not for simple morbid curiosity. Then sat on the information as it fed the machine decades later, we are now more informed and much more paranoid. Everything we eat or touch or...breathe we are closer to death. I was in that area in 1998...and the news then spent less time on it then I recall. As a college bound student, I heard murmurs of DuPont and jokes were made of this. Now...it seems bitterly grim. How many lives were destroyed because of shady dealings. When you peel the onion, you do weep. I love this flick. The flavor of that era is pitch perfect. The backroads of an industrial town, built under poor chemistry just sweats disease. And you walk out angered by it. The fight continues to this day.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":74339,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2019-12-06","keywords":"environmental pollution,water pollution,lawyer as protagonist,chemical pollution,chemical contamination","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3717512985","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTM3ZDdmMGMtN2I4ZC00NDFiLTlkNWUtY2YxM2MzNjU0NzNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTM3ZDdmMGMtN2I4ZC00NDFiLTlkNWUtY2YxM2MzNjU0NzNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Inspired by the true story of Robert Bilott, an attorney who took on the DuPont company in an environmental suit exposing a decades-long history of chemical pollution in drinking water."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0749263/","name":"Mark Ruffalo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004266/","name":"Anne Hathaway"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000209/","name":"Tim Robbins"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001331/","name":"Todd Haynes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0132772/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0783031/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0484360/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10164264/","name":"Nathaniel Rich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3918350/","name":"Mario Correa"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1996352/","name":"Matthew Michael Carnahan"}],"duration":"PT2H6M"}</script><metacontent="

Based on historical events, three young shepherds in Fátima, Portugal, report visions of the Virgin Mary, inspiring believers and angering officials of the Church and the government, who try to force them to recant their story." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2197936/","name":"Fatima","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTY4OWExZDYtN2ZkNy00ODA5LWE1MTktNGM3NzhmYTAwOTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA2MDQ3MTQ3._V1_.jpg","description":"Based on historical events, three young shepherds in Fátima, Portugal, report visions of the Virgin Mary, inspiring believers and angering officials of the Church and the government, who try to force them to recant their story.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2197936/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ScottBang"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Wonderful Relevant True Story","reviewBody":"Great movie and again relevant for our times. Shows us that in the face of a pandemic, strife, suffering and socialism run amok that faith can conquer all. Whether is be 1917 or 2020, Our Lady STILL cares and draws us to salvation and her Son. Well constructed with a great cast...the child actors are honestly some of the best I have ever seen. So moving and so believable. programme.title: Radioactive
Radioaktivna
programme.desc:
Radioactive: Directed by Marjane Satrapi. With Rosamund Pike, Yvette Feuer, Mirjam Novak, Ralph Berkin. The incredible true story of Marie Sklodowska-Curie and her Nobel Prize-winning work that changed the world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6017756/","name":"Radioactive","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGZkNzY3MmUtYjJlNC00NTM0LWFiNmYtZDA4NzBiMmU1MzI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE0OTU5Nzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The incredible true story of Marie Sklodowska-Curie and her Nobel Prize-winning work that changed the world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6017756/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"stanimiradeleva"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"The wikipedia page about Dr. Curie is way more exciting","reviewBody":"This movie is a pale and shallow effort to represent an extraordinary person with a remarkable life. Marie Curie is an absolute icon one of the most important scientists that ever existed and for sure the most important female scientist. Madamme Curie had a life full of challenges and she fought bravely to overcome barriers in the name of science. Her passion, her brilliance and her character changed the world in more than one way. She opened the way for women in science. She was the first female professor in the University of Paris. She was a poor immigrant, who had to work her way to the top. She was open about love, she was brave and humble and honest. She donated most of her Nobel money. Did we get that in the movie? Maybe 1% of it. The vision of the director about one of the greatest minds of all time is "Sheldon Cooper in a dress". There was some effort to suggest how her discoveries changed the world, but it did not succeed to present the scope and the greatest importance of her work.

This is not a bad movie, actually it is perfectly watchable. Actors are great and the love story between Marie and Pier is adorable. But given the fact that they had such an amazing life, I think the movie is a missed chance.

Still better love story than Twilight though","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15434,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-06-15","keywords":"scientist,physicist,science,physics,chemistry","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1577631257","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxMzMxYWQtZjM5Mi00ZGYzLTgyNzUtZWFjNDQ5NTliYjBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxMzMxYWQtZjM5Mi00ZGYzLTgyNzUtZWFjNDQ5NTliYjBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"A story of the scientific and romantic passions of Marie Sklodowska-Curie (Polish scientist) and Pierre Curie, and the reverberation of their discoveries throughout the 20th century."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0683253/","name":"Rosamund Pike"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275431/","name":"Yvette Feuer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1597296/","name":"Mirjam Novak"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2277869/","name":"Marjane Satrapi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319272/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2113666/","name":"Jack Thorne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9706688/","name":"Lauren Redniss"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

Madamme Curie had a life full of challenges and she fought bravely to overcome barriers in the name of science. Her passion, her brilliance and her character changed the world in more than one way. She opened the way for women in science. She was the first female professor in the University of Paris. She was a poor immigrant, who had to work her way to the top. She was open about love, she was brave and humble and honest. She donated most of her Nobel money. Did we get that in the movie? Maybe 1% of it. The vision of the director about one of the greatest minds of all time is "Sheldon Cooper in a dress". There was some effort to suggest how her discoveries changed the world, but it did not succeed to present the scope and the greatest importance of her work.

This is not a bad movie, actually it is perfectly watchable. Actors are great and the love story between Marie and Pier is adorable. But given the fact that they had such an amazing life, I think the movie is a missed chance.

Still better love story than Twilight though","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15434,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-06-15","keywords":"scientist,physicist,science,physics,chemistry","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1577631257","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxMzMxYWQtZjM5Mi00ZGYzLTgyNzUtZWFjNDQ5NTliYjBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxMzMxYWQtZjM5Mi00ZGYzLTgyNzUtZWFjNDQ5NTliYjBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"A story of the scientific and romantic passions of Marie Sklodowska-Curie (Polish scientist) and Pierre Curie, and the reverberation of their discoveries throughout the 20th century.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0683253/","name":"Rosamund Pike","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275431/","name":"Yvette Feuer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1597296/","name":"Mirjam Novak"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2277869/","name":"Marjane Satrapi"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2113666/","name":"Jack Thorne","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9706688/","name":"Lauren Redniss"],"duration":"PT1H49M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Homesman
Homesman
programme.desc:
The Homesman: Directed by Tommy Lee Jones. With Tommy Lee Jones, Hilary Swank, Grace Gummer, Miranda Otto. Three women who have been driven mad by pioneer life are to be transported across the country by covered wagon by the pious, independent-minded Mary Bee Cuddy, who in turn employs low-life drifter George Briggs to assist her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2398231/","name":"The Homesman","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4NTkxOTEyMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTI1NzcwMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three women who have been driven mad by pioneer life are to be transported across the country by covered wagon by the pious, independent-minded Mary Bee Cuddy, who in turn employs low-life drifter George Briggs to assist her.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2398231/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pcrawake"},"dateCreated":"2014-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"The way things were","reviewBody":"The Homesman, written and directed and starring Tommy Lee Jones tells the story of Mary Bee Cuddy (Hilary Swank) a spinster who takes on the responsibility of bringing three insane women to Iowa where they can be taken care of.

She saves or spares the life of George Briggs (Tommy Lee Jones) and enlists him on her arduous five week journey.

When you see Hilary Swank and Tommy Lee Jones, you know the acting is going to be stellar. The parts of the insane women, Arabella Sours (Grace Gummer), Theoline Belknapp (Miranda Otto), Gro Svendsen (Sonja Richter) because of the great directing remained the focus while being secondary characters. The movie had a Shakespearean feel to it and that is a great compliment. These ladies portrayed insanity, believably and that takes serious dedication and acting ability.

"The Homesman" was a tragedy and because of it, some people might not be able to pallet the story; there were some shocking attention grabbing scenes that the average viewer might not be prepared for. Those scenes, to me, were great examples of a different time, a time when life was hard and people died.

The Homesman is a story that sits with you and makes you thankful for many things, even if it just the shoes on your feet.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":32186,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Western"],"datePublished":"2014-05-18","keywords":"suicide by hanging,suicide,driven insane,abusive marriage,hanging","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1203089177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzMTE3NTgyOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTgxMDk2MjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzMTE3NTgyOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTgxMDk2MjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When three women living on the edge of the American frontier are driven mad by harsh pioneer life, the task of saving them falls to the pious, independent-minded Mary Bee Cuddy. Transporting the women by covered wagon to Iowa, she soon realizes just how daunting the journey will be, and employs a drifter to join her. The unlikely pair and the three women head east, where a waiting minister and his wife have offered to take the women in. But the group first must traverse the harsh Nebraska Territories marked by stark beauty, psychological peril and constant threat.
"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005476/","name":"Hilary Swank"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3501146/","name":"Grace Gummer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048273/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035645/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0029146/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1634307/","name":"Kieran Fitzgerald"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1364182/","name":"Wesley A. Oliver"}],"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="
